intro: Cyclosorus cocoslyrus, commonly known as the tropical cyclosorus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Menispermaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and thrives in humid, tropical environments. The plant features a climbing habit with palmately lobed leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its fruits are fleshy berries that contain seeds enclosed in a gelatinous sarcocarp. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
